hanzi-su-wiki:
税

Значения

Налог, пошлина

Мнемоника

Хлебный 禾 налог, собираемый 兑 в казну.

Варианты

稅
purpleculture_pinyin:
shuì
taxes; duties
налоги; обязанности
rtega_mnemonic:
税税RStaxes
  • grain 禾 taken by big brother 兑: taxes
purpleculture_info:
(Trad.: 稅)
Ideographic: Grain 禾 paid as tribute 兑; 兑 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
税收 [ shuì shōu ]: taxation
税务 [ shuì wù ]: taxation services; state revenue service
关税 [ guān shuì ]: customs duty; tariff
纳税 [ nà shuì ]: to pay taxes
增值税 [ zēng zhí shuì ]: value-added tax (VAT)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 禾 [ hé ] cereal, grain, rice; plant, stalk
    • 兑 [ duì ] cash, check; to exchange
heisig_chinese_memo: Nobody likes the tax man, so here it is only fitting that the person who comes over to take some of your wheat is depicted here as a devil. Keep in mind that in feudal societies there was no kind of money to speak of, so taxes were paid by serfs in wheat to the devils who came over to keep them poor.
heisig_constituent: tax, wheat, cereal, devil, horns, elder brother, teenager, mouth, human legs
koohiiStory1: Nobody likes the tax man, so here it is only fitting that the person who comes over to take some of your wheat is depicted here as a devil. Keep in mind that in feudal societies there was no kind of money to speak of, so taxes were paid by serfs in wheat to the devils who came over to keep them poor.
koohiiStory2: This is an easy one. Taxes is like the devil taking away your hard earned wheat.
jp_example_words:
関税(かんぜい): customs, duty, tariff
税務署(ぜいむしょ): tax office
課税(かぜい): taxation
税(ぜい): tax
税関(ぜいかん): customs house
税金(ぜいきん): tax, duty
免税(めんぜい): tax exemption
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A guard is at your door and wants some of your grains. This is the tax you pay for living in this town. Back in the day, grains were used like currency, so it makes sense that there was a grain tax in the olden days.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Can you imagine a guard coming to your door and demanding you pay your grain tax?
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You have to pay this tax, because if you don't the guard will cut you down with his special German saber, a zeiber (ぜい). "Don't you hear vat I zei? Pay ze tax or I vill zlei you!" he shouts.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You don't want to be sliced with the zeiber, so you listen to vat he zei zei zei's and pay the tax.
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 鋭 (するどい、エイ острый), 悦 (よろこぶ、エツ восторг)
Ru_Radicals: 儿 (ножки), 并, 口 (рот), 禾 (ость колоса)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: your eight elder brothers' (兑) grain (禾) has all gone on tax
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Nobody likes the tax man, so here it is only fitting that the person who comes over to take some of your wheat is depicted here as a devil. Keep in mind that in feudal societies there was no kind of money to speak of, so taxes were paid by serfs in wheat to the devils who came over to keep them poor.

税字的康熙字典解释
税字的源字形
税字的起名意思

国家向企业、集体、个人等按法规征收的货币或实物。

tax
Basic explanation of words
tax
shuì
Currency or objects collected by the state from enterprises, collectives, and individuals: taxes. tax. Taxes. tax rate. Tax law. tax system. Taxation.
name.
tax
Chinese dictionary definition of words
tax
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
tax
Source glyph
tax
Name meaning
The state collects currency or objects from enterprises, collectives, individuals, etc. in accordance with laws and regulations.
shuì, tuì
I shuì сущ.
налог, обложение, пошлина; налоговый, фискальный
正税 основной налог, годовая пошлина
农业税 сельскохозяйственный налог
关税 таможенные пошлины
II гл.
1) shuì облагать налогом, взимать пошлину; налогообложение
税权 право облагать налогом
2) shuì вносить поземельный налог
税限 срок внесения поземельного налога
3) shuì отказывать, дарить по завещанию
不敢税人 не осмелиться завещать, не посметь одарить посмертно (имуществом)
4) shuì освобождать, распрягать, отпрягать, распряжённый
税马于华山 остановить коней в горах Хуашань
5) shuì перен. отдыхать, останавливаться на отдых
税车 распрячь повозку, остановиться на отдых
6) tuì менять одежду на траурную, облекаться в траур
小功不税 во время малого траура 14 дней в траурные одежды не переодеваются
III shuì собств.
Шуй (фамилия)
Radicals: 禾, 兑  (grain, guard)
Meaning Mnemonic
A guard is at your door and wants some of your grains. This is the tax you pay for living in this town. Back in the day, grains were used like currency, so it makes sense that there was a grain tax in the olden days.
Can you imagine a guard coming to your door and demanding you pay your grain tax?
Reading Mnemonic
You have to pay this tax, because if you don't the guard will cut you down with his special German saber, a zeiber (ぜい). "Don't you hear vat I zei? Pay ze tax or I vill zlei you!" he shouts.
You don't want to be sliced with the zeiber, so you listen to vat he zei zei zei's and pay the tax.
